intro: Ceropegia planiflora, commonly known as the flatleaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, cordate leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale green. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its ability to store water in its thick stems and leaves. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Ceropegia planiflora is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and low maintenance requirements.
